root.texto: Long weekend listening: Podcasts that are worth checking out, a thread of things to listen and subscribe to. https://t.co/97CurxJQ93 Lore: Haunting rather than horrifying tales, a remarkable experience written and read by Aaron Mehnke. https://t.co/t9QDTBm2IJ Here's my review of Lore --the podcast and now, the TV series on Amazon. https://t.co/pemvphV8Uk No Such Thing as a Fish: from researchers of a UK trivia show called QI (Quite Interesting). Amazing facts, weekly. https://t.co/O06DMJjqfg The Memory Palace: each short episode is a jewel of writing and reading. Some will make your heart ache. https://t.co/Hcp7xL0hkE Desert Island Discs: Someone noteworthy discusses their ten favorite songs. Archives go back 50 years. Wonderful. https://t.co/Wwf7wpVWkT You Must Remember This. Seamy, intriguing, sometimes inspiring, insider stories from the Golden Age of Hollywood. https://t.co/F5V4FkPMzZ In Our Time: A nerdfiesta every week on ideas that matter from dinosaurs to novels to events. https://t.co/9WsdktKuc1 Monocle: The Urbanist. Why things are as they are for city dwellers, and what it can be for problem solvers. https://t.co/BLvUkYzHsT Pop Culture Happy Hour: So you can be as the unhip say, au courant about what the zeitgeist’s fussing over. https://t.co/TXTb0wDJUw History Extra: A fantastic way to keep up to date on new books, ideas, and findings by historians today. https://t.co/ZLZnnHqdva Intelligence Squared: Real debates; uncompromising presentations. Powerful discourse. https://t.co/04luHplWai Slate’s Whistlestop: John Dickerson’s engrossing presidential and political tales. https://t.co/PO52ZhGhXo The Guardian’s Audio Long Reads: Reportage/reflections at their long-form best, when you’d rather listen than read. https://t.co/S4PskTs6vu Great Lives: Each week an advocate pitches a life as one deserving of being called great with an expert weighing in. https://t.co/1KQBasDYVb Sinica Podcast: The many facets of a changing (and unchanging) China, from experts and observers. https://t.co/Fz77WAbSKx On The Media: Beyond who, what, where and why, including the how of news and newsmakers. https://t.co/S6caCAAU3P Slate Presents Lexicon Valley: For anyone who loves words, and the story of how they came to be. https://t.co/BBAFYZBNYD Note To Self: The human dimension of technology, interesting people responding to interesting things. https://t.co/b24Rsmoeft Welcome To Night Vale: 21st Century radio drama with a wacky, satirical slant. A rich, funny, strange enterprise. https://t.co/4ANfZQmpev Stuff You Should Know: A dorkfiesta shooting-the-breeze romp on random topics. https://t.co/EkqEmpbLoZ Radiolab: The podcast that got me into podcasts. The full potential of listening to stories on display. https://t.co/8XdHJmbDuC Reply All: Because Internet. https://t.co/rGO3x1uVVH Analog(ue): Because feels and tech. https://t.co/6zpwfQoriT The Essay: Every week, a topic, and for every topic, mutiple essays by multiple voices. https://t.co/IQEwAUkc6a Fresh Air: What talk radio ought to be like, but will never be, here at home at least. https://t.co/MdO0JgwpFW
